elements.content: Anion-assisted molecular assemblies of two cadmium coordination polymers, based on 44-sql subunits (or (4,4) net) and showing interesting frameworks of 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation and 2D → 3D polythreading, respectively, are reported.
elements.clean_text: Anion-assisted molecular assemblies of two cadmium coordination polymers, based on 44-sql subunits (or (4,4) net) and showing interesting frameworks of 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation and 2D → 3D polythreading, respectively, are reported.

elements.content: Two cadmium coordination polymers, showing interesting frameworks of 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation and 2D → 3D polythreading, respectively, have been successfully synthesized and characterized. The two structures are greatly affected by the initial metal salts, showing interesting anion-assisted structural variation from 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation to 2D → 3D polythreading.
elements.clean_text: Two cadmium coordination polymers, showing interesting frameworks of 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation and 2D → 3D polythreading, respectively, have been successfully synthesized and characterized. The two structures are greatly affected by the initial metal salts, showing interesting anion-assisted structural variation from 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation to 2D → 3D polythreading.

elements.content: Since the 1990s, chemists and material scientists have been focusing their research on exploring the correlation between structures and functions of crystalline materials in order to realize both structural control and functional tuning. A huge effort toward understanding the roles of different factors such as temperature, pH, solvents, stimulate agents, etc., promote greatly steps to any practical goals. Anions play extraordinary roles in environmental, chemical, and life-related processes, and thus anion bonding or templating is always a major issue of research from both an academic and practical point of view. Our current work of anion-assisted structural control of coordination complexes in mixed ligand system, N,N′-bis-(4-pyridyl-methyl) piperazine (BPMP) and dicyanamide (DCA−, N(CN)2 −), leads to two fascinating complexes, [Cd(BPMP)(DCA)2(H2O)] (1) and [Cd(BPMP)2(DCA)Cl]·2H2O (2), in which rare examples of structural variation from polycatenation to polythreading are presented.
elements.clean_text: Since the 1990s, chemists and material scientists have been focusing their research on exploring the correlation between structures and functions of crystalline materials in order to realize both structural control and functional tuning. A huge effort toward understanding the roles of different factors such as temperature, pH, solvents, stimulate agents, etc., promote greatly steps to any practical goals. Anions play extraordinary roles in environmental, chemical, and life-related processes, and thus anion bonding or templating is always a major issue of research from both an academic and practical point of view. Our current work of anion-assisted structural control of coordination complexes in mixed ligand system, N,N'-bis-(4-pyridyl-methyl) piperazine (BPMP) and dicyanamide (DCA-, N(CN)2 -), leads to two fascinating complexes, [Cd(BPMP)(DCA)2(H2O)] (1) and [Cd(BPMP)2(DCA)Cl]⋅2H2O (2), in which rare examples of structural variation from polycatenation to polythreading are presented.

elements.content: Polycatenation and polythreading are interesting networks of entangled systems, which is a noticeable realm of chemistry for its potential application in realms such as energy or electron transfer, and drug delivery and its intensive relationship with biological systems. The former example features inextricable, whereas the later extricable entanglements which are distinguished from common interpenetration by the feature of dimensionality increase. Delicate cases of polycatenated and polythreaded coordination networks have been assembled purposefully, and several others have been isolated serendipitously. In some rare cases, structural isomers of the individual subnets comprising entangled structures can be isolated by elaborate adjustment of experimental conditions. It is undoubtedly significant for the further understanding of possible factors that can direct, at least partly, the formation of entanglements.
elements.clean_text: Polycatenation and polythreading are interesting networks of entangled systems, which is a noticeable realm of chemistry for its potential application in realms such as energy or electron transfer, and drug delivery and its intensive relationship with biological systems. The former example features inextricable, whereas the later extricable entanglements which are distinguished from common interpenetration by the feature of dimensionality increase. Delicate cases of polycatenated and polythreaded coordination networks have been assembled purposefully, and several others have been isolated serendipitously. In some rare cases, structural isomers of the individual subnets comprising entangled structures can be isolated by elaborate adjustment of experimental conditions. It is undoubtedly significant for the further understanding of possible factors that can direct, at least partly, the formation of entanglements.

elements.content: An ambient diffusion reaction of mixed BPMP and DCA− in methanol (upper layer) and Cd(NO3)2·4H2O in water (bottom layer) with a molar ratio of 1:1:1 resulted in colorless block crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis after 1 week. A similar reaction procedure using CdCl2·2.5H2O as a metal source afforded colorless block crystals of 2 after 1 week. Both complexes 1 and 2 have been characterized by single crystal X-ray analyses. The topological analysis and some diagrams were produced using the TOPOS program.
elements.clean_text: An ambient diffusion reaction of mixed BPMP and DCA- in methanol (upper layer) and Cd(NO3)2⋅4H2O in water (bottom layer) with a molar ratio of 1:1:1 resulted in colorless block crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis after 1 week. A similar reaction procedure using CdCl2⋅2.5H2O as a metal source afforded colorless block crystals of 2 after 1 week. Both complexes 1 and 2 have been characterized by single crystal X-ray analyses. The topological analysis and some diagrams were produced using the TOPOS program.

elements.content: X-ray diffraction analysis shows that complex 1 features an 2D → 3D inclined polycatenated framework consisting of two sets of equivalent 2D layered motifs with 44-sql topology. The octahedral cadmium center of 1 is coordinated by two bidentate bridging BPMP ligands and two DCA− anion affording a μ1,5 coordination mode in the equatorial positions. One coordinated water molecular and one μ3 coordinated DCA− anion occupy the axial positions. The 44-sql layer is extended unevenly by pairs of BPMP and DCA−, respectively, as shown in Figure a. The rectangular window has a dimension of 16.64 Å × 8.85 Å with angles of 89.92° and 90.08° (defined by Cd···Cd distances and Cd···Cd···Cd angles). Packing of the layers generates two sets of layers oriented toward the [0, 1, 2] and [0, 1, 2̅] direction, respectively. These two sets of layers catenate to each other in a parallel−parallel (p-p) arrangement to form a 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation structure (Figure b). The angle between these two sets of layers is 71.5°. Further insight into one window of a layer shows that each window is catenated with other four windows from two different layers in the other set via Hopf links. Alternatively, it can be described that each window encircles two rods passing through it (Figure b, inset). The parallel/parallel inclined polycatenation is somewhat exceptional, although the 44-sql net is rather common.
elements.clean_text: X-ray diffraction analysis shows that complex 1 features an 2D → 3D inclined polycatenated framework consisting of two sets of equivalent 2D layered motifs with 44-sql topology. The octahedral cadmium center of 1 is coordinated by two bidentate bridging BPMP ligands and two DCA- anion affording a μ1,5 coordination mode in the equatorial positions. One coordinated water molecular and one μ3 coordinated DCA- anion occupy the axial positions. The 44-sql layer is extended unevenly by pairs of BPMP and DCA-, respectively, as shown in Figure a. The rectangular window has a dimension of 16.64 Å × 8.85 Å with angles of 89.92° and 90.08° (defined by Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd distances and Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd angles). Packing of the layers generates two sets of layers oriented toward the [0, 1, 2] and [0, 1, 2̅] direction, respectively. These two sets of layers catenate to each other in a parallel-parallel (p-p) arrangement to form a 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation structure (Figure b). The angle between these two sets of layers is 71.5°. Further insight into one window of a layer shows that each window is catenated with other four windows from two different layers in the other set via Hopf links. Alternatively, it can be described that each window encircles two rods passing through it (Figure b, inset). The parallel/parallel inclined polycatenation is somewhat exceptional, although the 44-sql net is rather common.

elements.content: (a) A view of the 2D 44-sql layer in 1; (b) schematic illustration of the polycatenation in 1; Inset: the topological links of the four-membered windows. Color code: dark-gray, carbon; blue, nitrogen; red, oxygen; purple, cadmium.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) A view of the 2D 44-sql layer in 1; (b) schematic illustration of the polycatenation in 1; Inset: the topological links of the four-membered windows. Color code: dark-gray, carbon; blue, nitrogen; red, oxygen; purple, cadmium.

elements.content: The crystallographically independent cadmium atom in complex 2 is coordinated by four nitrogen atoms of four BPMP ligands, one nitrogen atom of a DCA− ligand in μ1 coordination mode (end-on), and a chlorine atom in a slightly distorted octahedral geometry. Cadmium centers are connected by bridging BPMP ligands to form a 4-connected 2D layered structure with 44-sql topology (Figure a). Within each layer, square windows with dimension 17.15 Å × 17.00 Å and angles of 91.68° and 88.32° (defined by Cd···Cd distances and Cd···Cd···Cd angles) are observed. The end-on DCA− ligands and chlorine dangle above and below the layer plane, due to the statistic distribution of 50% in each part, exhibiting an overall multiarmed sheet pattern (Figure b). The multiarmed layers stack parallel along the [1, −2, −1] direction with an ABCABC sequence and interlamellar distance of ca. 3.39 Å, and the dangling DCA− ligands extend into the windows of adjacent layers in a mutual relationship (Figure ). The effective length from a cadmium node to the terminal uncoordinated nitrogen atom of the DCA− ligand is about 6.52 Å (longer than the stacking distance of layers) contributable to the formation of threading. Each window is pierced by two DCA− ligands that belong to two adjacent layers resulting in a 2D → 3D polythreading network (Figure ).
elements.clean_text: The crystallographically independent cadmium atom in complex 2 is coordinated by four nitrogen atoms of four BPMP ligands, one nitrogen atom of a DCA- ligand in μ1 coordination mode (end-on), and a chlorine atom in a slightly distorted octahedral geometry. Cadmium centers are connected by bridging BPMP ligands to form a 4-connected 2D layered structure with 44-sql topology (Figure a). Within each layer, square windows with dimension 17.15 Å × 17.00 Å and angles of 91.68° and 88.32° (defined by Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd distances and Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd angles) are observed. The end-on DCA- ligands and chlorine dangle above and below the layer plane, due to the statistic distribution of 50% in each part, exhibiting an overall multiarmed sheet pattern (Figure b). The multiarmed layers stack parallel along the [1, -2, -1] direction with an ABCABC sequence and interlamellar distance of ca. 3.39 Å, and the dangling DCA- ligands extend into the windows of adjacent layers in a mutual relationship (Figure ). The effective length from a cadmium node to the terminal uncoordinated nitrogen atom of the DCA- ligand is about 6.52 Å (longer than the stacking distance of layers) contributable to the formation of threading. Each window is pierced by two DCA- ligands that belong to two adjacent layers resulting in a 2D → 3D polythreading network (Figure ).

elements.content: (a) A view of the 2D 44-sql layer in 2; (b) side view of the 2D layer showing the dangling arms. Color code: yellow-green, chlorine; other colors as in Figure .
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) A view of the 2D 44-sql layer in 2; (b) side view of the 2D layer showing the dangling arms. Color code: yellow-green, chlorine; other colors as in Figure .

elements.content: Polythreading pattern of the 2D arm-sheets in 2.
elements.clean_text: 3  Polythreading pattern of the 2D arm-sheets in 2.

elements.content: As known, for coordination complexes based on metal cations and anionic ligands, the charge balances are fulfilled with the ligands. However, when neutral organic moieties are engaged in the construction of coordination polymers, anions must be involved in the formation of the frameworks to achieve charge compensation. Thus, coordination bonds may be formed between metal centers and anions, or anions exist only in the lattice acting as charge balancing species. In the anterior case, anions may greatly affect the whole topological structure by changing the coordination environment around metal cations. As to the two cadmium complexes reported here, structures of the complexes depend closely on the initial metal salts due to different coordination abilities of Cl− and NO3− showing interesting anion-assisted structural variation. Anionic Cl−, a better coordinator than NO3−, is involved in coordination in complex 2 and affects greatly both the stoichiometric ratio of ligands (mainly the anionic DCA− ligands per metal ion) and the coordination mode of DCA− ligands, leading to a dramatic change on the structures. In complex 1, the μ1,5 coordinated DCA− ligands bridge the [Cd(BPMP)] n 2+ chains into a 44-sql layer, whereas the μ3 coordinated DCA− ligands act as terminal groups to the metal centers. In complex 2, DCA− ligands afford μ1 coordination mode (end-on) dangling aside the 44-sql layer as open arms protruding from the layer resulting in a 2D → 3D polythreading structure. DCA− ligand is widely used in the formation of network structures for its variability in coordination modes as summarized by Batten and Murray. Many interesting frameworks have been prepared with the DCA− anion and bipyridyl ligands. For example, several complexes with DCA− anion and the 4,4′-bipyridine showing 2D (4,4) net topology or 3D interpenetrating network have been reported. And an unusual 2D → 3D parallel polycatenation with the DCA− anion and the 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane has been reported by Yan et al., with the DCA− displaying a μ1,5 bridging coordination mode.
elements.clean_text: As known, for coordination complexes based on metal cations and anionic ligands, the charge balances are fulfilled with the ligands. However, when neutral organic moieties are engaged in the construction of coordination polymers, anions must be involved in the formation of the frameworks to achieve charge compensation. Thus, coordination bonds may be formed between metal centers and anions, or anions exist only in the lattice acting as charge balancing species. In the anterior case, anions may greatly affect the whole topological structure by changing the coordination environment around metal cations. As to the two cadmium complexes reported here, structures of the complexes depend closely on the initial metal salts due to different coordination abilities of Cl- and NO3- showing interesting anion-assisted structural variation. Anionic Cl-, a better coordinator than NO3-, is involved in coordination in complex 2 and affects greatly both the stoichiometric ratio of ligands (mainly the anionic DCA- ligands per metal ion) and the coordination mode of DCA- ligands, leading to a dramatic change on the structures. In complex 1, the μ1,5 coordinated DCA- ligands bridge the [Cd(BPMP)] n  2+ chains into a 44-sql layer, whereas the μ3 coordinated DCA- ligands act as terminal groups to the metal centers. In complex 2, DCA- ligands afford μ1 coordination mode (end-on) dangling aside the 44-sql layer as open arms protruding from the layer resulting in a 2D → 3D polythreading structure. DCA- ligand is widely used in the formation of network structures for its variability in coordination modes as summarized by Batten and Murray. Many interesting frameworks have been prepared with the DCA- anion and bipyridyl ligands. For example, several complexes with DCA- anion and the 4,4'-bipyridine showing 2D (4,4) net topology or 3D interpenetrating network have been reported. And an unusual 2D → 3D parallel polycatenation with the DCA- anion and the 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane has been reported by Yan et al., with the DCA- displaying a μ1,5 bridging coordination mode.

elements.content: A 3D polythreading coordination framework based on 2D layer motifs was first observed in a zinc coordination polymer [Zn(HBTC)(4,4′-bpy)] n . From then on, several other polythreading networks assembled from 2D coordination motifs were isolated, of which the discovery of the first 1D + 2D → 3D polythreaded system excited chemists most. However, until recently, reported examples of polythreading containing finite components are still rare as evidenced in a recent review by Ciani. One of the oldest examples of 2D → 3D parallel/parallel inclined polycatenation based on 44-sql subunits was described by Janiak and co-workers in 1998, while the first example exhibiting 2D → 3D parallel/parallel inclined polycatenation based on (6,3) layers was reported by Zaworotko et al. in 1994. This report offers a snapshot of our work on anion-assisted structural control of coordination complexes where structural variation from 2D → 3D polycatenation to 2D → 3D polythreading entanglements was achieved by the presence of inorganic Cl−.
elements.clean_text: A 3D polythreading coordination framework based on 2D layer motifs was first observed in a zinc coordination polymer [Zn(HBTC)(4,4'-bpy)] n . From then on, several other polythreading networks assembled from 2D coordination motifs were isolated, of which the discovery of the first 1D + 2D → 3D polythreaded system excited chemists most. However, until recently, reported examples of polythreading containing finite components are still rare as evidenced in a recent review by Ciani. One of the oldest examples of 2D → 3D parallel/parallel inclined polycatenation based on 44-sql subunits was described by Janiak and co-workers in 1998, while the first example exhibiting 2D → 3D parallel/parallel inclined polycatenation based on (6,3) layers was reported by Zaworotko et al. in 1994. This report offers a snapshot of our work on anion-assisted structural control of coordination complexes where structural variation from 2D → 3D polycatenation to 2D → 3D polythreading entanglements was achieved by the presence of inorganic Cl-.

elements.content: The solid-state luminescence properties of complexes 1 and 2 as well as the free BPMP ligand were investigated at room temperature (Figure ). The strongest excitation peak for BPMP ligand is observed at 386 nm upon excitation at 300 nm. Both complexes exhibit red-shifted emission bands in comparison with the free ligands. Complex 1 exhibits an intense emission with a maximum at 437 nm upon excitation at 335 nm. This emission band can be attributed to a π−π* or π-n ligand centered electronic transition within the aromatic systems of the BPMP ligands. The maximum emission band of complex 2 upon excitation at 285 nm is observed at 507 nm. This low energy emission at 507 nm is assigned to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT) according to the literature. A detailed spectroscopic study of a possible structure related luminescent mechanism and theoretical calculation is underway.
elements.clean_text: The solid-state luminescence properties of complexes 1 and 2 as well as the free BPMP ligand were investigated at room temperature (Figure ). The strongest excitation peak for BPMP ligand is observed at 386 nm upon excitation at 300 nm. Both complexes exhibit red-shifted emission bands in comparison with the free ligands. Complex 1 exhibits an intense emission with a maximum at 437 nm upon excitation at 335 nm. This emission band can be attributed to a π-π* or π-n ligand centered electronic transition within the aromatic systems of the BPMP ligands. The maximum emission band of complex 2 upon excitation at 285 nm is observed at 507 nm. This low energy emission at 507 nm is assigned to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT) according to the literature. A detailed spectroscopic study of a possible structure related luminescent mechanism and theoretical calculation is underway.

elements.content: In summary, two cadmium coordination polymers showing interesting frameworks of 2D → 3D polycatenation and 2D → 3D polythreading, respectively, are reported. The two structures are greatly affected by the initial metal salts, showing interesting anion-assisted structural variation due to different coordination abilities of Cl− and NO3−.
elements.clean_text: In summary, two cadmium coordination polymers showing interesting frameworks of 2D → 3D polycatenation and 2D → 3D polythreading, respectively, are reported. The two structures are greatly affected by the initial metal salts, showing interesting anion-assisted structural variation due to different coordination abilities of Cl- and NO3-.

elements.content:
Experimental details, CIF files, IR spectra and XRPD diagrams for 1−2, and supplementary figures and tables. This information is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

References

Crystal data for 1: C20H22CdN10O, M = 530.87, monoclinic, P21/n (No. 14), a = 8.848(3) Å, b = 13.555(5) Å, c = 19.518(7) Å, β = 90.147(4) (°), V = 2341.0(15) Å3, Z = 4. Least-squares refinement based on 5288 reflections with I > 2σ(I) and 290 parameters led to final R 1 = 0.0862, wR 2 = 0.2756. Crystal data for 2: C34H44CdClN11O2, M = 786.65, triclinic, P1̅ (No. 2), a = 9.523(9) Å, b = 10.4239(3)Å, c= 11.2631(3) Å, α = 83.889(13), β = 69.065(9), γ = 71.052(11) (°), V = 987.55(4) Å3, Z = 1. Least-squares refinement based on 4268 reflections with I > 2σ(I) and 221 parameters led to final R 1 = 0.0533, wR 2 = 0.1593. The DCA− ligands and chlorine are disordered and were treated with model of occupancy 50% with the DCA− componment refined with isotropic thermal factors. CCDC-721829 (1), CCDC-722267 (2), contain the supplementary crystallographic data and can be obtained free of charge via http://www.ccdc.cam.uk/conts/retrivieving.html (or from The Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre, 12, Union Road, Cambridge, CB21EZ, UK; fax: (+44)1223-336-033; e-mail: deposit@ccdc.cam.ac.uk.

cln_elements.content:
The solid-state luminescence properties of complexes 1 and 2 as well as the free BPMP ligand were investigated at room temperature (Figure ). The strongest excitation peak for BPMP ligand is observed at 386 nm upon excitation at 300 nm. Both complexes exhibit red-shifted emission bands in comparison with the free ligands. Complex 1 exhibits an intense emission with a maximum at 437 nm upon excitation at 335 nm. This emission band can be attributed to a π−π* or π-n ligand centered electronic transition within the aromatic systems of the BPMP ligands. The maximum emission band of complex 2 upon excitation at 285 nm is observed at 507 nm. This low energy emission at 507 nm is assigned to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT) according to the literature. A detailed spectroscopic study of a possible structure related luminescent mechanism and theoretical calculation is underway.

Experimental details, CIF files, IR spectra and XRPD diagrams for 1−2, and supplementary figures and tables. This information is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

Least-squares refinement based on 4268 reflections with I > 2σ(I) and 221 parameters led to final R 1 = 0.0533, wR 2 = 0.1593. metadata.title:
Anion-Assisted Structural Variation of Cadmium Coordination Polymers: From 2D → 3D Inclined Polycatenation to 2D → 3D Polythreading
Communications
